purpose: Canonical list of web-search / meta-search providers to evaluate for the Evaluate Web Search Enrichment change. Seeded with known or likely documentation URLs where available and marked for verification.
notes: Entries are intentionally conservative and include a verification.status field. Please verify each docs URL, API doc URL, and rate-limit / auth details before using them to configure connectors or CI.

providers.name: SearXNG
providers.short_description: Open-source meta-search engine that proxies multiple search backends; ideal for self-hosted, privacy-preserving search aggregation.

auth.notes: Self-hosted instances typically permit unauthenticated access for internal use. Public instances may restrict usage.

rate_limits.recommended_for_project: depends on instance and upstream engines; start with 5-10 req/sec per instance for benchmarking and tune as needed

providers.pagination: provider-specific (proxied backends); responses return paged result sets

verification.comment: Verify which upstream sources will be proxied and confirm terms of use for each.

next_steps: Deploy a local SearXNG Docker instance for benchmarking
Record instance config (enabled engines) and measure latency/throughput

providers.name: Tavily

auth.notes: Vendor-provided credentials (contact vendor for developer access and rate-limits).

rate_limits.recommended_for_project: start with 1 req/sec for initial tests until vendor quotas are confirmed

verification.comment: Obtain vendor API docs, pricing, and acceptable-use policy prior to any benchmarking.

next_steps: Request trial API key and official doc link from the vendor
Confirm allowable caching and PII handling

providers.name: Brave Search API
providers.short_description: Brave Search (privacy-focused search engine) and associated API options for programmatic search results.

auth.notes: Hosted provider; API access may be gated by paid tiers or partnerships.

rate_limits.recommended_for_project: conservative default 1 req/sec for initial benchmarking; confirm official quotas if moving forward

verification.comment: Identify official API docs and confirm cost/quotas for programmatic use.

next_steps: Locate Brave Search API docs or contact Brave for developer access
Evaluate costs per 1k queries and caching rules

providers.name: Google Programmable Search (Custom Search JSON API)
providers.short_description: Google Custom Search JSON API for programmable search over web or site-limited engines (requires API key and engine config).

auth.notes: API key and custom search engine ID (CX) required. Quotas and billing controlled via Google Cloud.

rate_limits.published: varies by billing account and enabled quotas
rate_limits.recommended_for_project: do not rely on free quota; use a billing-enabled quota for any production/pilot evaluation

verification.comment: Confirm current free quota, pricing, and terms for caching and retention with Google Cloud docs.

next_steps: Create a Google Cloud project and enable the Custom Search API for testing
Carefully record pricing and request quotas for nightly volumes

providers.name: Perplexica
providers.short_description: Semantic search / managed vector search vendor (vendor or self-hosted depending on offering).

auth.notes: Vendor-managed access; self-host availability varies by vendor offering.

rate_limits.recommended_for_project: start with 0.5-1 req/sec for semantic queries; verify vendor limits

verification.comment: Confirm whether Perplexica offers a self-hosted option for air-gapped evaluation and get API docs.

next_steps: Request trial account and documentation from vendor or locate self-hosting guides
Define evaluation criteria for semantic relevance and citation quality

providers.name: DuckDuckGo Instant Answer (optional)
providers.short_description: Instant Answer API for structured answers and quick summaries; limited compared to full search APIs but useful as an additional signal.

auth.notes: Public Instant Answer API has limited capabilities and usage recommendations.

rate_limits.recommended_for_project: treat as low-volume auxiliary signal; 1 req/sec default

verification.comment: Confirm Instant Answer suitability for enrichment tasks and caching policy.

next_steps: Test Instant Answer responses for the representative prompt set and measure coverage

providers.name: Bing Web Search API (Microsoft)
providers.short_description: Microsoft Bing Web Search API via Azure Cognitive Services; commercial service with documented quotas and billing.

auth.notes: Requires Azure subscription key; billing applies for larger volumes.

rate_limits.published: documented by Azure; depends on pricing tier
rate_limits.recommended_for_project: start with low test throughput (1 req/sec) and evaluate pricing for pilot

verification.comment: Record exact quota numbers for the intended Azure pricing tier before benchmarking at scale.

next_steps: Provision Azure subscription test key and record costs per 1k queries
